Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
aptToolThis class is for the generic APT-style milling tool. FIXME This class is not complete!
ballnoseToolThis class is for the ballnose tool. It was created first because the ballnose tool is easy
canonClass canon was created so canonLine and machineStatus could easily share some things. The only shared items are the unimplemented function abc2dir, and the types degrees and toolNumber. At this time, the list of tools will be handled within the machineStatus class
canonLineA canonLine object represents one canonical command. Each gcode line produces one or more canonical commands. It can either be a motion command (one of LINEAR_TRAVERSE LINEAR_FEED ARC_FEED), or a motionless command (anything else) You cannot create objects of this class - instead, create an object of a class that inherits from this class via canonLineFactory()
canonMotionThis class is for the canonical commands STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE, STRAIGHT_FEED, and ARC_FEED. canonMotion is an ABC. Its children should only be instantiated via canonLine::canonLineFactory(), which creates linearMotion objects for STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE and STRAIGHT_FEED commands, and helicalMotion objects for ARC_FEED commands
canonMotionlessA canonical command that (generally) does not cause or alter axis motion This class is for anything other than STRAIGHT_FEED, STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE, and ARC_FEED - including changes in feedrate, spindle speed, tool, coolant, ending the program, etc
coolantStruct
cylindricalToolThis class is for the standard endmill
dispShapeStores shapes to be displayed, as well as data for how to display them
g2mThis class does the high level stuff for creating a model from gcode. It runs the interpreter, and creates a canonLine object for each canonical command generated by the interpreter. It also does error checking and stores the cannonLines. It calls methods on each canonLine object to display it. Eventually it will enable the user to see which gcode line creates which bit of the path, and vice versa
g2m_threadedThis class extends g2m to allow parallel processing. It was split out of g2m and is not guaranteed to function - there's no point testing when it will definitely crash. It will cause numerous segfaults with opencascade 6.3.0 and earlier
helicalMotionFor the canonical command ARC_FEED. This class handles both planar arcs and helical arcs. Inherits from canonMotion
latheToolA 2d tool for the lathe. This class is incomplete. Furthermore, at this time g2m only supports milling
linearMotionFor the canonical commands STRAIGHT_FEED and STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE. This class inherits from canonMotion
lnkThis class is the link between qocc and my cam- and gcode-related code. It was originally named 'link' but that caused compilation problems in qoccharnesswindow
Log
machineStatusThis class contains the machine's state for one canonical command. The information stored includes the coolant state, spindle speed and direction, feedrate, start and end pose, tool in use Important: 'pose' refers to how the machine's axes are positioned, while 'direction' refers to the direction of motion
millToolRotary tool for the milling machine It must be possible to create both a 2d and a 3d representation of a millTool
nanotimer
nearestEdges
pntPair
QoccApplication
QoccDocumentThis class provides a base object for "proxy" OpenCascade objects, and a set of starter files for new classes
QoccHarnessWindow
QoccInputOutputThis class provides input/output elements of the QtOpenCascade Toolkit. Currently a "work-in-progress", based on the standard examples. The main lesson learnt here is that with Qt4 you cannot directly cast QString to a "char *", so to transform to a OCC Standard_CString use
QoccViewerContextThis class provides a simple document element of the QtOpenCascade Toolkit
QoccViewWidgetThis class provides the view element of the QtOpenCascade Toolkit. This class provides a Widget to view OpenCASCADE objects within a Qt4 hosted application
QtApplicationThis class provides an application extension for the QtOpenCascade Toolkit
ShHealOper_ChangeOrientation
ShHealOper_CloseContourCloses contours
ShHealOper_EdgeDivideIntended for spitting edge in accordance to the specified mode and value
ShHealOper_FillHolesIntended for filling holes
ShHealOper_RemoveFaceClass intended to removing faces from shape
ShHealOper_RemoveInternalWiresIntended for removing internal wires from faces
ShHealOper_SewingIntended for sewing of shapes
ShHealOper_ShapeProcessClass for performing Shape healing operations on the shape
ShHealOper_SplitCurve2dAuxiliary class for class ShHealOper_EdgeDivide
ShHealOper_SplitCurve3dAuxiliary class for class ShHealOper_EdgeDivide
ShHealOper_ToolBase class for geometric healing operations
toolBase class for all tools, whether they are mill tools, lathe tools, or something else
tst
twopnts
uioThis class does user i/o - i.e. gui stuff This class replaces uiStuff. It contains similar functions, as well as pointers to commonly-referenced objects in qocc. There is no need to inherit from this class to be able to use it's functions, unlike uiStuff. However, it is necessary for the ctor to be called before using any of the functions in the class!
